intro: Hydrocotyle fluminensis, commonly known as Brazilian water pennywort, is a perennial aquatic plant native to South America. It has small, round, floating leaves that are typically less than 1 inch in diameter. The plant produces tiny white flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments. Hydrocotyle fluminensis is often used in ornamental ponds and wetlands for its aesthetic appeal and ecological benefits.
